__note__: This is file is autogenerated, do not edit it manually. For more info https://data.aoe4world.com/

data.name: Battering Ram
data.description:
Durable infantry transport effective against buildings and walls.
+ High ranged armor
+ High health
- Can only attack buildings
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Bombard
data.description:
Intimidating siege gun excellent against buildings or any stubborn targets.
+ High damage
- Must be set up to fire

data.name: Carrack
data.description:
Large sailed war vessel armed with broadside cannons.
+ Anti-structure specialist
- Low movement speed

data.name: Counterweight Trebuchet
data.description:
Powerful siege engine effective at destroying buildings and walls over a great distance.
+ Bonus damage vs buildings
- Must be set up to fire
- Inaccurate against units

data.name: Crossbowman
data.description:
High damage ranged unit best against armored targets.
+ Anti-armor specialist
- Low health

data.name: Demolition Ship
data.description:
Small ship packed with explosives. Detonates when killed, damaging any units in the area.
- Damage is reduced further from the explosion center
- No weapons other than self-destruction

data.name: Fishing Boat
data.description:
Small boat that gathers Food from either Deep Water Fish or Shoreline Fish. Drops off gathered resources at the Dock.
+ Can repair
- No combat

variations.description:
Small boat that gathers Food from either Deep Water Fish or Shoreline Fish. Drops off gathered resources at the Dock.
+ Can repair
+ Fires a low damage arrow

data.name: Galley
data.description:
Oared war vessel armed with a crew of archers.
+ Increased maneuverability
+ Benefits from ranged damage Blacksmith technology

data.name: Handcannoneer
data.description:
Powerful all-purpose ranged infantry.
+ High damage
- High cost
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Horseman
data.description:
Mobile cavalry effective at raiding and flanking.
+ High movement speed
- Weak vs melee units

data.name: Hulk
data.description:
Ship equipped with broadside ballistae.
+ Strong against Arrow Ships
- Lower maneuverability

data.name: Knight
data.description:
Expensive cavalry with a powerful charge.
+ Heavy armor
+ Strong in melee combat
- Countered by Spearmen and Crossbowmen

data.name: Longbowman
data.description:
Cheap long-ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ Long range
+ Can construct Palings to fend off cavalry charges
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Man-at-Arms
data.description:
Tough infantry with good damage.
+ High armor
- Slow movement

data.name: Mangonel
data.description:
Fires multiple projectiles dealing damage in an area.
+ Effective against massed units
- Must be set up to fire

data.name: Monk
data.description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites.
+ Heals friendly units
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Ribauldequin
data.description:
Five-barreled gunpowder weapon effective against massed units. Deals little damage to buildings.
+ Can hit multiple targets in a single volley
- Short range
- Low ranged armor

data.name: Scout
data.description:
Lightly armed cavalry effective at exploring the world, hunting wildlife, and herding Sheep.
+ Able to see into Stealth Forests
+ High movement speed
- Very weak in combat

data.name: Siege Tower
data.description:
Tall infantry transport with no combat capability. Allows garrisoned infantry to be unloaded directly onto Stone Walls.
+ High ranged armor
- Cannot attack
- Slow movement speed

data.name: Spearman
data.description:
Infantry best used against mounted units.
+ Anti-cavalry specialist
- Susceptible to light ranged attacks
- Weak against armored infantry

data.name: Springald
data.description:
Effective at taking out high value targets at long range. Fires after quickly setting up.
+ Long range
+ Bonus damage vs siege engines
- Trivial damage vs. buildings

data.name: Trade Ship
data.description:
Trade Ships generate Gold when assigned to a trade route with a Coastal Trade Post or a Market near the shore. The distance between the trade target and Market determines the amount of Gold. Once assigned to trade, the Trade Ship will make repeated trips between its Home Dock and the trade target. You can assign a new Home Dock if you wish to.
- No combat

data.name: Trader
data.description: Traders generate Gold when assigned to trade with a Trade Post or another player’s Market. The distance between the trade target and Market determines the amount of Gold. Once assigned to trade, the Trader makes repeated trips between its Home Market and the trade target. You can assign a new Home Market if you wish to.

data.name: Transport Ship
data.description:
Large oared vessel able to transport land units across water.
+ Can be garrisoned by any unit
+ Uses sight range of units in garrison
- No combat

data.name: Villager
data.description:
Gathers Wood, Food, Stone, and Gold. Builds and repairs buildings and can repair siege engines and naval units.
- Weak in combat

variations.description:
Gathers Wood, Food, Stone, and Gold. Builds and repairs buildings and can repair siege engines and naval units.
+ Uses a bow to attack
- Weak in combat

Gathers Wood, Food, and Gold. Builds and repairs buildings and can repair siege engines and naval units.
- Weak in combat
- Unable to gather Stone (build an Ovoo to gather Stone)

data.name: Archer
data.description:
Cheap ranged infantry with good damage vs. unarmored targets.
+ High rate of fire
- Weak vs armored targets

data.name: Culverin
data.description:
Long-range cannon made for destroying siege equipment.
+ Bonus damage to siege weapons
+ Attacks without having to set up
- Low damage to buildings

data.name: Landsknecht
data.description:
Brave, unarmored infantry with enormous two-handed swords effective in mixed armies.
+ Melee attack deals area damage
- Low health

data.name: Prelate
data.description:
Support unit with no combat capability. Automatically inspires Villagers to greatly improve their gather rate. Can pick up Relics, convert enemy units, and capture Sacred Sites starting in the Castle Age (III).
+ Heals friendly units
- Low health

data.description:

+ Anti-armor specialist
+ Comes with melee armor
- Low health

data.name: Khan
data.description:
Potent ranged cavalry leader able to ignite Signal Arrows to improve the combat capabilities of nearby military units. Reappears at a Town Center if killed.
+ Vision of a Scout
+ Herds sheep
+ High utility in large armies
+ Automatically improves as the Ages are advanced
- Only a single Khan per Mongol Civilization at a time

data.name: Lodya Fishing Boat
data.description:
Small boat that gathers Food from either Deep Water Fish or Shoreline Fish. Does not require a Dock to drop off gathered Food and gathers faster than a regular Fishing Boat.

data.name: Lodya Trade Ship
data.description:
Trade Ships generate Gold when assigned to a trade route with a Coastal Trade Post or a Market near the shore. Once assigned to trade, the Trade Ship will make repeated trips between its home Dock and the trade target. You can assign a new home Dock if you wish to.
The Lodya can be converted to any other type of ship.
